title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Café, from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service], 1819–20
title_raw: Plate Design:  Café, from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper mounted on gray/blue paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite on mount, lower center:  Cafe–
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer Samuels, New York
description: Six figures are grouped on the porch of a coffee plantation house in Arabia (indicated by the decorative plaque above the wall moulding.  A gentelman in high hat points to a botanical book showing a drawing of the coffee plant.  A man, seated at a table, appears to be holding a coffee bean pod in his right hand.  To his left, a woman is pouring coffee into a cup held by a young boy.  A woman, seen through the doorway (rear left) is grinding coffee beans.  Another woman, seen outdoors (rear right) appears to be working at a bean roasting apparatus.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Café, from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service], 1819–20. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper mounted on gray/blue paper. 
1989-13-26
